intro: Pisonia floridana, commonly known as the Florida pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. The Florida pisonia is adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils along the Florida coast.
